trial_identification.studytitle: Breathe Easier Online: Engaging and re-connecting 'at-risk' children with chronic respiratory illness.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Engaging and re-connecting 'at-risk' children with chronic respiratory illness

interventions.interventions: Randomised to either a weekly 30 minute individual online contact with a psychologist group or a control wait-list group for 9 months and follow up data collection at 12 months.
interventions.comparator: The control wait-list group will be offered the intervention after the initial 12month period.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Increased physical,mental and social well-being quantified by the completion of questionnaires at 0,6,9 and 12months.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Improvement of adherence to medical therpies.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Children aged between 10-15years of age with chronic respiratory illness who belong to the 'at-risk' group ie single parent families,low socioeconomic class parent with a mental illnes.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Children without chronic respiratory illness, those not 'at-risk' and children outside the age bracket.

trial_design.concealment: A black sticker obscures the next treatment group and is only removed once enrolled.
trial_design.sequence: Randomisation of participants will be stratified by dwelling location and will be computer generated. Allocation to groups will be concealed.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Children with chronic illness sometimes feel disconnected and lonely. In this study we will evaluate the use of a psycho-social intervention program for 'at-risk' children (ie. child with chronic illness, low socio-economic groups) to improve their sense of well-being, adherence to therapies and health outcomes.
